channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Hawkers hope physical, virtual tours will rejuvenate Chinatown Complex
item.description:
August 22, 2020 7:08 PM

SINGAPORE - For many of his 37 years as a hawker in Chinatown Complex, Mr Poon Sun Hay would rise at 5am and head to his Pan Ji cooked food stall to make sachima, a crispy snack covered in sugar syrup.

item.title: SCDF divers find 14-year-old’s body in waters off Changi Beach Park
item.description:
August 22, 2020 6:48 PM

SINGAPORE - Divers from the Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) found a 14-year-old male teenager’s body in the waters off Changi Beach Park on Saturday (Aug 22).

item.title: This week's top reads from The Straits Times
item.description:
August 22, 2020 6:30 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the week's top reads.

item.title: 280 foreign workers' approval to resume work rescinded after they did not go for mandatory Covid-19 testing
item.description:
August 22, 2020 3:59 PM

About 102,000 workers have yet to have their mandatory testing booked in.

item.title: 50 new Covid-19 cases in S'pore, including 2 in community and 5 imported
item.description:
August 22, 2020 3:48 PM

The two community cases are both Singaporeans.

item.title: Expect road closures, traffic delays with opening of Parliament on Monday
item.description:
August 22, 2020 1:29 PM

SINGAPORE - Motorists can expect a few roads to be closed and traffic delays in several areas next week, as the 14th Parliament opens on Monday (Aug 24) at Parliament House and The Arts House.

item.title: 7 new MOE kindergartens inside primary schools to open in 2023
item.description:
August 22, 2020 12:32 PM

Each kindergarten will provide full-day Kindergarten Care services and offer about 120 K1 places.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 22
item.description:
August 22, 2020 8:30 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday, Aug 22.

item.title: S'pore scientists find milder variant of Covid-19 virus
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Researchers in Singapore have discovered a new variant of the Covid-19 virus that causes less severe infections.

item.title: Singapore, China consult on travellers who still test positive
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The authorities here are working with their Chinese counterparts to provide feedback on travellers returning to China who have been deemed non-infectious by Singapore, but have a positive Covid-19 polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test result.

item.title: Virtual event to help job seekers extended to Sept
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A virtual event offering career workshops and a guide to resources for skills training will be extended till next month, following a run last week that attracted more than 257,000 participants.

item.title: Coronavirus: Supply of vaccine likely to be limited when made available in Singapore
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Initially, the authorities may have to prioritise vulnerable patient groups and front-line workers.

item.title: Work resumed at all BTO sites, except one pending approval
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Construction works have resumed at 89 Build-To-Order (BTO) sites as of Monday, Minister for Na-tional Development Desmond Lee said yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Aviation sector welcomes easing of curbs in Singapore
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Aviation stakeholders yesterday welcomed the decision to ease border restrictions for travellers from Brunei and New Zealand, noting that it was an important step for recovery of the air travel sector.

item.title: PSLE and O, N, A levels to proceed with special safety measures in place
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The four national examinations - the PSLE, N levels, O levels and A levels - will go on as scheduled from Sept 14 to Dec 2, but there will be special arrangements made to ensure that students and invigilators remain safe from the Covid-19 virus.

item.title: Unilateral reopening of borders a small, cautious step to revive Changi: Ong
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The unilateral reopening of borders to Brunei and New Zealand is a "small, cautious" step that can resuscitate Changi Airport.

item.title: Forum: Better to teach kids to say no to sex
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Sex below 16 years of age is an offence. This is the clear message that all schools need to deliver to school children.

item.title: Safety measures to be taken
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Q How and where can students get tested for Covid-19?

item.title: NUHS won't seek $296k repayment of bills from worker
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A healthcare group, which runs National University Hospital (NUH) and Alexandra Hospital, has said it is not pursuing a $296,000 award it won in court against a quadriplegic foreign worker, whose employer had defaulted on paying his medical treatment bills.

item.title: Singapore to allow general travel to Brunei, New Zealand from Sept
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

General travel to Brunei and New Zealand will be allowed from Sept 1, but travellers should not simply hop on a plane to these destinations, Health Minister Gan Kim Yong said yesterday.

item.title: Rules to ensure safety at national exams spelt out
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Students who test positive for Covid-19, or who are on a quarantine order or stay-home notice, will not be allowed to sit the national written examinations at the end of this year.

item.title: Appeal hearing postponed after Sengkang Town Council's request
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The appeal hearing involving Aljunied-Hougang Town Council (AHTC), which is run by the Workers' Party (WP), has been postponed, following a request by the new Sengkang Town Council (SKTC).

item.title: Reforestation not a cheap fix for climate change
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Trees are often touted as nature's quick fix for climate change.

item.title: Jail for e-scooter rider who caused woman's skull injury
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A man rode an unregistered e-scooter against the flow of traffic in Selegie Road last October and struck a pedestrian, causing her to suffer a fractured skull.

item.title: Coronavirus: F&B outlets must play recorded music softly
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

This way, patrons do not have to raise their voices to be heard.

item.title: Keeping Singapore clean a priority, says Grace Fu
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Keeping Singapore clean will be the priority of the Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment (MSE) in the months ahead, with new legislation to be introduced in the next three to six months.

item.title: Ex-lecturer jailed over upskirt videos of student
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A former lecturer of a post-secondary institution who shot upskirt videos of a female student was sentenced yesterday to eight weeks' jail.

item.title: Lucky Plaza and Peninsula Plaza to have odd-even entry restrictions on weekends
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Entry into shopping malls Lucky Plaza and Peninsula Plaza on weekends will soon only be allowed based on the last digit of a visitor's identity card or foreign identification card, as part of measures to limit crowds.

item.title: Singapore eases some border control measures
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will ease travel restrictions on visitors from Brunei and New Zealand from Sept 1, in a small but significant step towards reviving an ailing Changi air hub battered by the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Jail for couple who abused maid, including kicking and punching her
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman who repeatedly abused her domestic helper from her first day of work was sentenced yesterday to 21 months' imprisonment.

item.title: Recent cases among foreign workers involved those who were in quarantine facilities
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A number of the recent cases of Covid-19 among foreign workers here are those who had previously been in the dormitories but were later placed in quarantine facilities after they were exposed to others who were infected.

item.title: Green light for exercise classes at more venues
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Exercise classes conducted by instructors will be allowed to take place at more open spaces at SportSG sport centres and Housing Board areas from Sept 1, Education Minister Lawrence Wong said at a virtual multi-ministry press conference yesterday.

item.title: Pandemic driving adoption of health tech for the elderly
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Before the Covid-19 pandemic, older adults in Singapore faced many challenges, including isolation and loneliness, mobility and movement, and care coordination. All of these challenges have been amplified by the pandemic and circuit breaker restrictions. The silver lining of Covid-19 for Singapore's elderly population is that now everyone faces these same challenges and is working together to find solutions that will outlast the pandemic.

item.title: MOM will take up issue with employers if workers are not paid: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

If there are instances where foreign workers are not being paid, the Government will approach the employer to find out what is going on as it expects employers to do their part and pay their workers, Education Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Students and parents alike divided on holding exams
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Students and parents alike are divided about this year's national examinations taking place, given the pandemic.

item.title: Camera shop employee among five unlinked community cases
item.description:
August 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A 61-year-old Singaporean man who went to work at SLR Revolution, a camera shop in Excelsior Shopping Centre, is among five unlinked Covid-19 community cases reported by the Health Ministry yesterday.

item.title: Man who works at Excelsior Shopping Centre camera shop among 5 unlinked Covid-19 community cases in Singapore
item.description:
August 22, 2020 12:05 AM

Tampines Mall, West Mall and Century Square were also added to the list of places visited by Covid-19 patients while they were still infectious.
